iati-activity.title: Cooperation between UNECA and Finland on ICT development in Africa
iati-activity.description: The funding is aimed for cluster 1: Infromation Policy Development (NICI plans). The support is provided as programmatic support to the ECA ISTD sub-programme, earmarked for strategic subclusters of the ISTD programme and subject to ECA annual planning and budgeting. Part of the support will be used for Finnish Technical assistance.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Supporting learning of children with special needs
iati-activity.description: The project supports two university cliniques and an institute for special education (Kenya and Zambia) in their work to study the learning disabilities of children.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Leadership Enhancement Programme. The programme aims to enhance local partnersâ leadership skills for social work. The programme covering all countries under the East Africa Regional Programme is a result of a long process that started in 1997 with a capacity-building project in Tanzania. Good experiences from Tanzania led to the widening and reformulation of the project into a large programme. Now the programme covers all Fidaâs partner churches in East Africa and is centrally coordinated. The programme concentrates on mainstreaming capacity-building in all projects_ developing the partnersâ main coordinating and training structures_ and training them in leadership and management skills. In addition_ the programme offers the partners an opportunity to network with each other. As the programme progresses_ the partnersâ leadership capacities increase and they will be able to successfully implement local social work programmes. This will contribute to the increase of their impact on local communities.

location.name: Kenya_ Tanzania_ Uganda_ Ethiopia_ Sudan_ Sub-Saharan Africa

iati-activity.title: Project for Training Health Professionals in Northern-Somalia
iati-activity.description: The project will support health sector development in Northern Somalia by strengthening the human resource base in region_s public and private health sectors.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Project against the human trafficking for commercial exploitation
iati-activity.description: The Project studies the nature and extent of the human trafficking problem in South Africa_ Botswana and Namibia linked among others to FIFA 2010 Football World Cup held in South Africa. The Project formulates and implements prevention activities through training the public leaders and launching public awareness building campaigns. The Project also facilitates the reintegration of victims of human trafficking back to the society and reduces the spread of HIV/AIDS in the group.

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Churches United Against HIV and AIDS in Southern and Eastern Africa
iati-activity.description: CUAHA is a wide faith-based network programme focusing especially on capacity-building of programme partners working with and for people who are infected with or affected by HIV and AIDS_ and for promoting treatment_ prevention_ support and care. Programme partners in Afrcica are 37 churches and other FBO; Anglican_ Catholic_ Evengelical Lutheran_ Methodist_ Orthodox and Pentecostal. The aim of CUAHA is to encourage and assist partners to work together in collaboration with other actors (NGOs_ govermental organisations) on HIV/AIDS response at all levels.

iati-activity.title: Enhancing the African Unions Mediation Capacity
iati-activity.description: The African Unionâs Conflict Management Division (AU CMD) and the African Centre for the Constructive Resolution of Disputes (ACCORD) ) with the support of Crisis Management Initiative (CMI) will undertake a joint project aimed at building the mediation capacity of the African Union through evidenced-based self-reflection_ the development of an AU mediation strategy and capacity building programming. The partners will study various African mediation case studies_ identify lessons learned and best practises_ generate strategic and operational recommendations_ develop guidelines and procedures_ develop mediation support mechanisms_ conduct training courses and support fact-finding_ mediation_ and post-conflict field missions.

iati-activity.title: Support to the achievement of water and sanitation MDGs
iati-activity.description: WSPâs global core program mission is to reduce poverty by helping countries and their people achieve sustainable access to improved water_ sanitation and hygienic practices. WSP-Africa seeks to develop new and comparative bodies of knowledge in areas that are judged most likely to assist achieving the WSS MDGs. The goal of the WSP programme is to accelerate the development of water and sanitation services_ to implement sector reform to support capacity development for national and regional policy makers_ and to finance strategies to stimulate investments towards meeting WSS MDGs in focus countries.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: NGO Support / Support to the socially marginalised communities in the Southern Africa
iati-activity.description: African sovieties are challenged by serious problems i.e. shortage of food, health, unemployment, hiv/aids, ecological issues, instability, urbanuzation, violence and xenophobia. Activities are implemented through churches, whose role in African societies is central.They however lack competence and capacity to respond to these needs. The aim of this programme is to increase the capacities of the local partner organisations to become competent in responding to the challenges. The target groups of the pilot programme are the marginalised and most vulnerable members of the communities. Regional approach is needed because problems do not respect national borders. The activities can not be covered by CUAHA network, which is focusing on hiv/aids related issues and whose constituency is different from that of Lunodia.

iati-activity.title: African Training Management
iati-activity.description: As regards the objective, the Project was initiated to respond to the long felt need for improving the management and performance of enterprises in Africa, specifically the shortage of trained and experi-enced managers, which has been considered as one of the main causes for the weak performance of enterprises. The Project is addressing this by seconding experienced managers and supporting training to upgrade management skills. On a wider perspective the project also aimed to enhance the contribu-tion of productive enterprises to African economies. In this context, it was viewed as a necessary com-plement to the macroeconomic reforms undertaken by the African governments to re-structure their na-tional economies and restore growth, in light of the serious economic crisis facing most countries on the continent in the late 1980s.

iati-activity.title: EAC Lake Victoria Basin Commission Trust Fund
iati-activity.description: The Lake Victoria Basin Commission (LVBC) has invited the Government of Finland to join the LVBC partnership fund. The LVBC was established by the East African Community (EAC; members Burundi, Kenia, Ruanda, Tansania and Uganda) in 2005. The LVBC partnership fund is part of a partnership agreement signed in 2001 between the EAC and the Governments of Sweden, France and Norway, the World Bank and East African Development Bank. The overall objective of the fund is to promote sustainable development in the Lake Victoria Basin. The specific objective is to provide sources of funding for the identification and formulation of projects and activities; policy development and capacity building.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian Aid to the West African region through WHO
iati-activity.description: Humanitarian Aid to the West African region through WHO.

iati-activity.title: African Union ICT-Summit 2010: Finnish support
iati-activity.description: Finland will cooperate with the AU Commission for the preparation of the AU-2010 January Summit dedicated for âInformation and Communications Technologies in Africa: Challenges and Prospects for Development. Finland would focus its support in particular for the track concerning the enabling environment (regulatory aspects etc.) and would identify a consultant to do substance work i.e. to develop report on this topic.

iati-activity.title: INGO Aid to ISS - African Security Analysis Programme (ASAP)
iati-activity.description: Aim of the Programme is to contribute to African and international efforts at the prevention, management and resolution of African conflicts and crisis situations by providing independent, timely and in-depth analysis of threats to human security in key countries of Sub-Saharan Africa.

iati-activity.title: Support to the Africa programme of the Rights and Resources Initiative
iati-activity.description: The Rights and Resources Initiative (RRI) is a global coalition of 12 organizations for accelerating reforms in forest tenure and governance, policies and business models, mainly in developing countries (East and South Asia, West and Central Africa and Central and South America). The purpose is to support processes directly benefiting the poor, by securing tenure rights of the local communities in respect of land, forests and other natural resources, and by strengthening the ability of the poor to excercise their rights, including benefits from the trade of wood and other forest products. In this respect, special emphasis in being laid on women and indigenous peoples. Finnish support is allocated to RRI Africa-programme in West and Central Africa.

iati-activity.title: Support to UN-Alliance of Civilizations Youth Solidarity Fund
iati-activity.description: The United Nations Alliance of Civilizations (UNAOC) is an initiative of the UN Secretary-General which aims to improve understanding and cooperative relations among nations and peoples across cultures and religions, and to help counter the forces that fuel polarization and extremism. Youth Solidarity Fund supports youth-led projects addressing areas of primary concern to the UNAoC, i.e. fostering mutual respect, understanding and long-term relationships between peoples of different cultures and religions.
iati-activity.participating-org: UNITED NATIONS AGENCIES, FUNDS AND COMMISSIONS

iati-activity.title: Sustainable and Secure Rural Water Services in Nothwest Somalia
iati-activity.description: To enable rural communities in Somaliland, particularly women and children, to develop secure, predictable coping mechanisms in the face of water scarcity recurrent droughts exacerbated by climate change.
iati-activity.sector: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

iati-activity.title: Humanitarian Aid to support food Aid in-kind through WFP
iati-activity.description: Food Aid in-kind through WFP. Aid will be provided as rapeseed oil to Mauritania and Mali.

iati-activity.title: UNU-WIDER twinning with AERC
iati-activity.description: UNU-WIDER proposes to establish a twinning partnership with the African Economic Research Consortium (AERC), based in Nairobi, Kenya. The purpose of the partnerhip is to promote collaboration between the two institutions and to boost their research and capacity-building activities. The four-year (2010-13) initiative consists of three main components: 1) establishing and supposrting a a team of UNU-WIDER researchers in Nairobi, 2) collaborating with AERC in several areas and 3) bringing researchers from AERC to Helsinki for capacity-building purposes. The initiative will bring UNU-WIDER closer to the African countries and will also expand its outreach to other research institutions as well as policy makers in Africa. The initiative will also add crucial weight to AERC's research capacity through the sharing of knowledge and training with UNU-WIDER researchers.

iati-activity.title: Building Capacity for HIV Work in Africa
iati-activity.description: United Bible Societies has created specific HIV Service for the task to coordinate all Bible Societies'HIV/AIDS-activities in Africa, develop in collaboration with stakeholders new program modules, ensure the quality through training, coaching and empowering Project Coordinators in national Bible Societies. Objectices are to enhanche gender mainstreaming, develop quality tools, build the capacity, develop sustainability.

iati-activity.title: African leadership ICT programme
iati-activity.description: Goal is to develop a group of ICT, Education, S&T and Knowledge Society leaders that can become agents for change in their own country and be catalysts for regional cooperation in the domain of ICT, Education, S&T and Knowledge Societies both at the country and sub-regional levels. The programme will build and strengthen visioning, strategic planning and management, policy making and related strategic capacities of future leaders and policy makers in Africa on ICTsâ role in the development of inclusive and sustainable Knowledge Societies in Africa.

iati-activity.title: CGIAR - cooperation on agricultural research and education
iati-activity.description: The programme aims at supporting collaboration on agricultural research and education/training between a network of partners: selected CGIAR-institutes, and local research and higher education institutions in Finland and African partner countries. The programme is expected to improve agricultural knowledge and skills contributing to improvement of agricultural yields and food security in the region. The programme is implemented in Ghana, Mali, Benin and Senegal in West Africa; in Kenya and Uganda in East Africa.

location.name: Ghana, Mali, Benin and Senegal in West Africa; Kenya and Uganda in East Africa

iati-activity.title: APF Support unit, Finnish contribution
iati-activity.description: The Africa Partnership Forum Support Unit, hosted at the OECD since 2006 prepares Africa Partnership Forum meetings and provide a means of following up on discussions and decisions. The Unit was seen asconsistent with the OECDâs strategy for Global Relations and viewed as a means of taking forward relations with Africa. At the technical/professional level the Support Unit developed productive links from the outset with key African institutions and partners (NEPAD Secretariat, African Union Secretariat and UN Economic Commission for Africa â UNECA).

iati-activity.title: Support to Effectivesess Forum by AfDB
iati-activity.description: The African Development Bank is organizing the regional event on aid effectiveness in Tunis 4-5.11.2010. The event is part of a larger regional platform (African Partnership Facility), which will be officially launched in the event. The topic of the event is aid effectiveness, south-south cooperation and capacity development and its tentative theme is From Aid Effectiveness to Development Effectiveness. The tentative agenda consist of plenary sessions and specific roundtable sessions.

iati-activity.title: CICC Coalition for the International Criminal Court; Africa Effort
iati-activity.description: The CICC promotes international criminal law and fight against impunity e.g. by providing expertise, supporting cooperation between authorities and raising awareness of the ICC. The CICC has a crucial role especially in Africa, where the five situation countries of the ICC are located. In its Africa efforts the CICC emphasizes promoting ratifications and implementation of the Rome Statute and developing national judicial systems by e.g. raising awareness of the ICC and impunity. By strengthening the capacity of local NGOs, the CICC contributes to peace-building and development of the civil society. The goals of the CICC are in line with the goals of the Finnish Development Policy; the fight against impunity strengthens the linkage between security, human rights and development, thus creating conditions for lasting peace and sustainable development.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Pelastakaa lapset)
iati-activity.description: Reduce the exploitation of child workers in Benin, Burkina Faso, CÃ´te dâIvoire, Mali, Niger and Togo and strengthen MAEJTs capacity in child protection

iati-activity.title: The African Peacebuilding Coordination Programme (APCP), Phase II
iati-activity.description: The African Peacebuilding Coordination Programme (APCP) was established by ACCORD and the Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland in June 2007. The Programme has focused on enhancing coherence and coordination in peacebuilding, with the aim of promoting and enhancing local ownership in peacebuilding processes, as well as supporting the design and implementation of peacebuilding policy frameworks. The overall objective of the phase II is supporting enhanced coherence and coordination, across the peace, security, humanitarian, development and human rights dimensions, in peacebuilding operations in Africa, in support of the attainment of just and sustainable peace in countries emerging from conflict.
iati-activity.participating-org: African Centre for the Constructive Resolution of Disputes (ACCORD)
